author: Lukas Stefanko
description: Picture collection of Windows Ransomware WannaCry.
title: WannaCry Ransomware picture collection from infected countries around the world

author: Elizabeth Weise, and Mike Snider
description: Ransomware attack repercussions continue, but U.S. may have dodged a major hit
title: How U.S. dodged a bullet in Friday's massive global ransomware attack

author: Shaun Murphy
description: Protect yourself from ransomware attacks like WannaCry or WannaCrypt by taking these steps to defend against viruses.
title: How to Protect Yourself From Ransomware Like WannaCry

description: The ransomware software, which hit hospitals in the UK particularly severely, is thought to be based upon a spying tool stolen from the US National Security earlier this year
title: Ransomware attack hits 200,000 computers across the globe

author: Mark Weatherford
description: President Trump's executive order last week on cybersecurity might help prevent future ransomware cyberattacks like WannaCry.
title: How Trump’s Executive Order Could Prevent Future Ransomware Attacks

author: Robert McMillan
description: Cybersecurity researchers identified a digital clue connecting the global ransomware assault to previous cyberattacks by a group linked to North Korea.
title: Researchers Identify Clue Connecting Ransomware Assault to Group Tied to North Korea

author: Russell Brandom
description: Researchers at Kaspersky Lab have uncovered new evidence linking the WannaCry ransomware code to North Korea. In a post today, the group detailed a segment of code used in both an early WannaCry...
title: The WannaCry ransomware has mysterious ties to North Korea

author: Adam Bienkov
description: NHS Digital said that a patch was made available that could have prevented the "ransomware" attack.
title: NHS cyberattack: Staff were sent Windows patch that could have prevented ransomware attack

author: Joseph Menn
description: A computer virus that exploits the same vulnerability as the global "ransomware" attack has latched on to more than 200,000 computers and begun manufacturing digital currency, experts said Tuesday.
title: Hackers mint crypto-currency with technique in global 'ransomware' attack

author: Melanie Eversley
description: Clues point to a link between a hacking group connected to North Korea and the ransomware computer attacks that have crippled computer systems worldwide, according to two cyber security firms.
title: Signs show possible link between ransomware hacking and North Korea
